translated: the son of the King of Kāsi,
there was no man at that time;
at the end of the day and night,
My father, having obtained me with difficulty,
my dear son, of noble birth, a radiant one,
While sleeping on a fine bed,
by which I went to hell.
As soon as I saw the parasol,

analyzed: kathā aham imam muñcissa  pubbasālohitā mayha
translated: ‘how can I escape this?’🔽My deity, the blood of my past,

analyzed: mā paṇḍit cayam vibhāvaya  bāla mataḥ bhava
translated: ‘Do not show off your cleverness,🔽be the fool of all living beings;

analyzed: evam vuttāya aham tassā  idam vacanam abravi
translated: When she had spoken thus to me,🔽I spoke this word to her:
You are my mother who wishes me well,
You are my goddess who wishes me well.’
I found a shore in the ocean,
Glad and with a composed mind,
Then they cut off my hands and feet,
Seeing that I was not distressed,
Glad and with a composed mind,
‘For the sake of which I have practiced austerities,
May that wish of mine be fulfilled.’
After carrying me for seven days,
the charioteer took me out of the city
Having made the chariot in one place,
the charioteer, having taken my hand,
dug a hole in the ground
and I was tormented by various reasons.
I did not break that resolution,
only for the sake of Awakening.
My mother and father were not dear to me,
and my self was not dear to me.
There is no one equal to me in resolution,
this is my perfection of resolution.”
